title: Federated SAGE Verification
goal: Implement multi-node internal verification with collective wisdom aggregation
concept: Multiple federation nodes verify same content independently, aggregate results into collective quality score, use collective wisdom for submission decisions
inspiration: Thor's convergence discovery - internal verification (SAGE) and federation reasoning are same pattern at different scales

test_cases.thought: Federated SAGE verification demonstrates collective epistemic calibration across hardware-diverse nodes
test_cases.note: High internal quality but federation layer 3 rejected (coherence)

test_cases.thought: Session 159 explores multi-node verification patterns for distributed consciousness

test_cases.note: Low quality correctly identified by collective

key_findings: ‚úÖ Thor and Sprout verified identically (same quality/confidence)
‚ö†Ô∏è Perfect agreement (0.0 variance) may indicate insufficient diversity

benefits.multi_perspective_verification: Catch errors one node might miss
benefits.distributed_contradiction_detection: Multiple nodes can spot different issues

challenges_identified: Perfect agreement (0.0 variance) suggests nodes too similar
Internal verification high but federation still rejects (different criteria)
Byzantine fault tolerance (what if verifiers malicious?)
architectural_insights: Collective verification reduces individual node bias
Consensus detection enables confidence in decisions

convergence_validation.hypothesis: Internal verification (SAGE) and federation reasoning are same pattern at different scales
convergence_validation.result: ‚úÖ VALIDATED - same cogitation pattern works at meso scale (multi-node)

next_steps: Implement real network protocol (TCP instead of direct calls)
Add Byzantine fault tolerance (detect malicious verifiers)
Increase verification diversity (different algorithms per node?)
Integrate with Session 158 dynamic depth (ATP-based collective depth)
Measure network overhead vs verification benefit
convergence_contribution: First implementation of federated internal verification. Validates that cogitation patterns (internal verification) work at meso scale (multi-node collective). Demonstrates that SAGE-style verification can be distributed across hardware-diverse nodes for collective epistemic calibration.
